segment.source: Creating effective application control policies with AppLocker starts by creating the rules for each app.
segment.target: Creating effective application control policies with AppLocker starts by creating the rules for each app.

segment.source: Rules are grouped into one of five rule collections.
segment.target: Rules are grouped into one of five rule collections.

segment.source: The rule collection can be configured to be enforced or to run in Audit only mode.
segment.target: The rule collection can be configured to be enforced or to run in Audit only mode.

segment.source: An AppLocker policy includes the rules in the five rule collections and the enforcement settings for each rule collection.
segment.target: An AppLocker policy includes the rules in the five rule collections and the enforcement settings for each rule collection.

segment.source: Step 1: Use your plan
segment.target: Step 1: Use your plan

segment.source: You can develop an application control policy plan to guide you in making successful deployment decisions.
segment.target: You can develop an application control policy plan to guide you in making successful deployment decisions.

segment.source: For more info about how to do this and what you should consider, see the AppLocker Design Guide.
segment.target: For more info about how to do this and what you should consider, see the AppLocker Design Guide.

segment.target: This guide is intended for security architects, security administrators, and system administrators.

segment.source: Step 2: Create your rules and rule collections
segment.target: Step 2: Create your rules and rule collections

segment.source: Each rule applies to one or more apps, and it imposes a specific rule condition on them.
segment.target: Each rule applies to one or more apps, and it imposes a specific rule condition on them.

segment.source: Rules can be created individually or they can be generated by the Automatically Generate Rules Wizard.
segment.target: Rules can be created individually or they can be generated by the Automatically Generate Rules Wizard.

segment.source: For the steps to create the rules, see Create Your AppLocker rules.
segment.target: For the steps to create the rules, see Create Your AppLocker rules.

segment.source: Step 3: Configure the enforcement setting
segment.target: Step 3: Configure the enforcement setting

segment.source: An AppLocker policy is a set of rule collections that are configured with a rule enforcement setting.
segment.target: An AppLocker policy is a set of rule collections that are configured with a rule enforcement setting.

segment.source: The enforcement setting can be Enforce rules, Audit only, or Not configured.
segment.target: The enforcement setting can be Enforce rules, Audit only, or Not configured.

segment.source: If an AppLocker policy has at least one rule, and it is set to Not configured, all the rules in that policy will be enforced.
segment.target: If an AppLocker policy has at least one rule, and it is set to Not configured, all the rules in that policy will be enforced.

segment.source: For info about configuring the rule enforcement setting, see Configure an AppLocker policy for audit only and Configure an AppLocker policy for enforce rules.
segment.target: For info about configuring the rule enforcement setting, see Configure an AppLocker policy for audit only and Configure an AppLocker policy for enforce rules.

segment.source: Step 4: Update the GPO
segment.target: Step 4: Update the GPO

segment.source: AppLocker policies can be defined locally on a device or applied through Group Policy.
segment.target: AppLocker policies can be defined locally on a device or applied through Group Policy.

segment.source: To use Group Policy to apply AppLocker policies, you must create a new Group Policy Object (GPO) or you must update an existing GPO.
segment.target: To use Group Policy to apply AppLocker policies, you must create a new Group Policy Object (GPO) or you must update an existing GPO.

segment.source: You can create or modify AppLocker policies by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), or you can import an AppLocker policy into a GPO.
segment.target: You can create or modify AppLocker policies by using the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC), or you can import an AppLocker policy into a GPO.

segment.source: For the procedure to do this, see Import an AppLocker policy into a GPO.
segment.target: For the procedure to do this, see Import an AppLocker policy into a GPO.

segment.source: Step 5: Test the effect of the policy
segment.target: Step 5: Test the effect of the policy

segment.source: In a test environment or with the enforcement setting set at Audit only, verify that the results of the policy are what you intended.
segment.target: In a test environment or with the enforcement setting set at Audit only, verify that the results of the policy are what you intended.

segment.source: For info about testing a policy, see Test and update an AppLocker policy.
segment.target: For info about testing a policy, see Test and update an AppLocker policy.

segment.source: Step 6: Implement the policy
segment.target: Step 6: Implement the policy

segment.source: Depending on your deployment method, import the AppLocker policy to the GPO in your production environment, or if the policy is already deployed, change the enforcement setting to your production environment value—Enforce rules or Audit only.
segment.target: Depending on your deployment method, import the AppLocker policy to the GPO in your production environment, or if the policy is already deployed, change the enforcement setting to your production environment value—Enforce rules or Audit only.

segment.source: Step 7: Test the effect of the policy and adjust
segment.target: Step 7: Test the effect of the policy and adjust

segment.source: Validate the effect of the policy by analyzing the AppLocker logs for application usage, and then modify the policy as necessary.
segment.target: Validate the effect of the policy by analyzing the AppLocker logs for application usage, and then modify the policy as necessary.

segment.source: To do this, see Monitor app usage with AppLocker.
segment.target: To do this, see Monitor app usage with AppLocker.
